00027 #ifndef GRAPH_HXX
00028 #define GRAPH_HXX
00029 
00030 #include"IntList.hxx"
00031 #include"IntIterator.hxx"
00032 
00033 class Graph {
00034 friend class EdgeList;
00035 public:
00036   Graph( int n );               // construct an n-node graph with no edges
00037   ~Graph();
00038   int number_of_nodes() const;
00039   int number_of_edges() const;
00040   void add_edge( int i, int j );
00041   bool is_edge( int i, int j ) const;
00042 private:
00043   int my_n;                     // number of nodes
00044   int my_m;                     // number of edges
00045   IntList * my_adj;             // array of adjacency lists
00046 };
00047 
00048 class EdgeList {
00049 public:
00050   EdgeList( const Graph & G, int i ); // for node i
00051   bool more() const;                  // are there more edges?
00052 
00053   // the following assume that more() is true!
00054   void next();                        // move to the next one
00055   int head() const;                   // return head of current edge
00056   int tail() const;                   // return tail of current edge
00057   // when listing edges for node i, tail() is always i and head() is the
00058   // other node
00059 
00060   // to call the iterator in a loop, do
00061   //    EdgeList EL( G, i );
00062   //    while ( EL.more() ) {
00063   //      EL.next();
00064   //      // do something with EL.head() and EL.tail()
00065   //    }
00066 
00067 private:
00068   const Graph & my_graph;
00069   int my_node;                  // current node
00070   int my_other_node;            // the other end of the current edge
00071   IntIterator my_adj;           // current position in adjacency list
00072 };
00073 #endif
